data.text:
Fact 1 - Usher Raymond IV was born on October 14, 1978, in Dallas, Texas, USA.

Fact 2 - He is an American singer, songwriter, actor, and dancer, often referred to as the "King of R&B."

Fact 3 - Usher gained fame in the late 1990s with the release of his second album, "My Way."

Fact 4 - His breakthrough single "You Make Me Wanna..." earned him his first Grammy Award for Best Male R&B Vocal Performance.

Fact 5 - Usher's album "Confessions" (2004) is one of the best-selling R&B albums in the United States.

Fact 6 - He is known for his smooth voice, impressive dance moves, and charismatic stage presence.

Fact 7 - Usher has won numerous awards, including eight Grammy Awards and 18 Billboard Music Awards.

Fact 8 - In addition to his solo career, Usher has collaborated with artists like Alicia Keys, Lil Jon, and Ludacris.

Fact 9 - He made his acting debut in the 1998 film "The Faculty" and has appeared in several other movies, including "In the Mix" and "Hands of Stone."

Fact 10 - Usher is a successful entrepreneur and has ventured into business, including owning a share of the Cleveland Cavaliers NBA team.

Fact 11 - He was discovered at the age of 13 after participating in a local singing competition in Atlanta.

Fact 12 - Usher's philanthropic efforts include supporting organizations like UNICEF, Save the Music Foundation, and the Boys & Girls Clubs of America.

Fact 13 - His hit single "Yeah!" featuring Lil Jon and Ludacris topped the charts and became one of the best-selling digital singles of all time.

Fact 14 - Usher has been recognized for his impact on music, receiving a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2016.

Fact 15 - He served as a coach on the reality TV show "The Voice" during its fourth and sixth seasons.

Fact 16 - Usher's dance skills are often highlighted in his music videos, contributing to his status as an all-around entertainer.

Fact 17 - He is credited with influencing a new generation of R&B artists and remains a respected figure in the music industry.

Fact 18 - Usher's album "8701" includes the popular songs "U Remind Me" and "U Got It Bad."

Fact 19 - He is involved in various charitable initiatives, including his New Look Foundation, which focuses on youth empowerment.

Fact 20 - Usher is known for his dynamic stage performances and has embarked on multiple successful concert tours.

Fact 21 - He has received the honor of being named one of the "50 Most Influential R&B Artists of All Time" by Rolling Stone magazine.

Fact 22 - Usher has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, recognizing his contributions to the music industry.

Fact 23 - His album "Raymond v. Raymond" explores personal themes and earned him a Grammy Award for Best Contemporary R&B Album.

Fact 24 - Usher is actively involved in mentorship programs, guiding aspiring artists through his New Look Foundation.

Fact 25 - He has explored various musical styles, seamlessly blending R&B, pop, and hip-hop influences in his work.

Fact 26 - Usher's impact extends beyond music, with his influence felt in fashion, dance, and overall entertainment culture.

Fact 27 - He has received the BET Honor for his contributions to entertainment and philanthropy.

Fact 28 - Usher's singles "Burn" and "Confessions Part II" from the album "Confessions" both topped the Billboard Hot 100.

Fact 29 - He has maintained relevance in the ever-evolving music industry, adapting to changing trends while staying true to his artistic vision.

Fact 30 - Usher continues to inspire and entertain, solidifying his legacy as a legendary figure in contemporary R&B.
